fields.headline: Match-fixing denial
fields.bodyText: Accusations of match-fixing involving the Sao Paulo team Corinthians emerged yesterday, one day after a Brazilian judge ordered the arrest of Kia Joorabchian, whose company Media Sports Investments is an investor in the club. Speaking in Sao Paulo, the two attorneys behind an investigation into MSI claimed to have evidence that Corinthians had been involved in match-fixing. "We have indications that results were manipulated," said the federal attorney Sìlvio Luìs Martins de Oliveira. "There are many hours of [intercepted] telephone calls and there are conversations about this." Corinthians deny any allegations of impropriety, as do MSI and Joorabchian, the agent of West Ham's Carlos Tevez.
